newsitem.title: USA: Computervision ends OSS pact, sees charges.
newsitem.headline: Computervision ends OSS pact, sees charges.

text.p: Computervision Corp said on late Wednesday that its agreement with JF Lehman & Co for its Open Service Solutions business unit had been terminated, but that it had a non-binding letter of intent with a new buyer.
It said MD Sass Investors Services, a New York investment management firm, and affiliate entities will buy 51 percent interest in the business.
Computervision said it will receive $30 million cash, $25 million in a preferred note, and 49 percent of the new company's common equity.
Additionally, MD Sass will have the option to buy 10 percent of the company's interest in the new entity.
The company said it will expense about $5 million in previously deferred fees and expenses in the fourth quarter as a result of terminating the pact with JF Lehman.
Additionally, it said it expects a non-recurring charge in the first quarter for about $7 million, related primarily to completing the separation of its services business from the software company.
